Key Question: Do the Wattasids march to relieve Tétouan, or write it off?

Leaders: Various chiefs, no unified command


Situation: The Berber tribes of the Rif mountains have never fully submitted to anyone—not the Marinids, not the current warlord, not anyone. They raid, they trade, they feud among themselves. Some hate the usurper in Tétouan. Some hate Christians more. Some simply want plunder.
